forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Cloudy, with a low around 51. South wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind 14 to 36 mph, with gusts as high as 54 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks in Downtown San Francisco, an air of muted anticipation blankets the city, cloaked in a veil of low-hanging clouds and sprinkles of rain. The streets carry hints of the storms to come, draped with moisture that hovers in the cool morning air. With temperatures holding steady around 51, the south winds cut through this humidity, teasing with gusts that stir the imagination—remnants of the night whispering of change. This morning’s forecast teeters on the edge, promising rain that crescendoes into showers and thunderstorms as the day unfolds.

As the hours wear on, the heavens seem poised to unleash their bounty, with a 90% chance of precipitation pacing the day, ultimately leading to a dismal high of only 57. Sheltering yourself from the chill and dampness will be essential, so wrap yourself in layers—perhaps a light waterproof jacket over a warm sweater, ensuring comfort as you navigate the gathering clouds and growing winds. Umbrellas might become your best companion, as sporadic showers transform into the kind of weather that invites cozy conversations over coffee indoors. While the heart may yearn for outdoor adventures, today’s brisk temperament seems more suited to quiet introspection within warm, welcoming spaces, where the clatter of rain against windows accompanies a well-worn novel or a gathering of friends.
